title: Where was the first continent? - Quora

response.answer_text: The First modern humans were in Africa and Asia, but not sure which first, new DNA studies are being done as we speak. However, according to the Annunaki story of creation called the Enuma Elish written in cuneiform says that there indeed was a garden called Eden, and that was in Southwest Asia. But the oldest mines ever discovered are in South Africa are over 100,000 years old. It’s a pick em, I would not bet on which it was…

Meet, Rodinia.  This beauty existed about 1 billion years ago to 700 million years ago before it started breaking up. Rodinia is Russian meaning ‘to beget’ or ‘Give birth’ to symbolize that this was the first actual continent we know about. The Ocean surrounding it was named ‘Mirovia' which translates to ‘Global (Ocean)’ in Russian.  It should be noted that all reconstructions of Rodinia are estimations. We have difficulty back-tracking everything plate tectonics has done, especially so long ago.

The answer to your question would be Asia. The first thing is that continents are not discovered as such. In the start there was only one called pangae. Due to the continental drift it shattered into 7 as we know now. Now life started in asia-Harappan civilization, Chinese civilization. And in Africa Egyptian civilization. Now we have evidence to suggest there was trade between Africa and Harappa. Due to presence of Egyptian seals. So to answer you Egypt found Harrapa which happens to be in Asia
